alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A line of showers and isolated thunderstorms capable of producing funnel clouds will affect Putnam and Bureau Counties... At 539 PM CDT...A line of showers and isolated thunderstorms capable of producing funnel clouds were located along a line extending from near Walnut to Hennepin...and slowly moving southwest at 5 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Princeton, Hennepin, Spring Valley, Henry, DePue, Granville, Walnut, Ladd, Wyanet, Tiskilwa, La Moille, Dalzell, Buda, Bureau Junction, McNabb, Putnam, Mark, Ohio, Cherry and Malden. Funnel clouds of this nature are short lived and rarely touch the ground. However, if you notice one approaching the ground, move indoors to a place of safety. The National Weather Service will continue to closely monitor the situation. Please forward reports of funnel cloud sightings to the nearest law enforcement agency for relay to the National Weather Service.
